data.text:
Meet Turkish pop star, Atiye.

Atiye has been described as â€œThe J.Lo of Turkeyâ€ in her official press release, which is an incredible description, so Iâ€™m just going to take as an objective fact.

The German-born songstress dropped her debut album at 17 years old with Sony Records, followed by a self-titled sophomore record that spawned two Top 5 singles in Turkey: â€œMuammaâ€ and â€œSalla.â€ She also won Best Turkish Act at the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards, and later notched another #1 hit with â€œBudur.â€

And now, like so many successful overseas acts, sheâ€™s set her sights beyond Europe.

Atiye has a debut US single coming out this week â€” today, actually! â€” called â€œCome To Me,â€ which Iâ€™m happy to premiere this morning on MuuMuse.

The David Anthony-produced English language track is an all-out club corker with a subtle Eastern flair throughout and big blasts of EDM beat drops, all wrapped around a sultry little hook: â€œCome to me, come to me nowâ€¦baby, I need you right now!â€

Check out her American debut single â€œCome To Meâ€ at the top, and make sure to check out some of her past Turkish hits as well. Iâ€™m kind of living for her â€œMuammaâ€ moves.

Hereâ€™s to more and more international pop acts gaining recognition stateside!
